def_cn: (戏剧、书的)场面，片段;(电影)镜头
def_en: A scene in a play, film, or book is part of it in which a series of events happen in the same place.

def_cn: (给人以某种印象的)景象，场景，场面
def_en: You refer to a place as a scene when you are describing its appearance and indicating what impression it makes on you.

def_cn: (通过画面显示的或看到的)事件，场面，情景
def_en: You can describe an event that you see, or that is broadcast or shown in a picture, as a scene of a particular kind.
The scene of an event is the place where it happened.
You can refer to an area of activity as a particular type of scene .
Paintings and drawings of places are sometimes called scenes .
If you make a scene, you embarrass people by publicly showing your anger about something.

def_cn: 在幕后;秘密地;不公开地
def_en: If something is done behind the scenes, it is done secretly rather than publicly.

def_cn: (电影、戏剧、广播电视节目的制作)在幕后,在后台
def_en: If you refer to what happens behind the scenes, you are referring to what happens during the making of a film, play, or radio or television programme.
If you have a change of scene, you go somewhere different after being in a particular place for a long time.

def_cn: 介绍背景;事先介绍情况
def_en: If you set the scene for someone, you tell them what they need to know in order to understand what is going to happen or be said next.

def_cn: 为…铺平道路;为…做好准备
def_en: Something that sets the scene for a particular event creates the conditions in which the event is likely to happen.

def_cn: 登场/离场;到场/消失;介入/摆脱
def_en: When a person or thing appears on the scene, they come into being or become involved in something. When they disappear from the scene, they are no longer there or are no longer involved.
If you say that an activity or place is not your scene, you mean that you do not like it or enjoy it.
